title: Mr. Spock and Dr. McCoy
subtitle: The Head and the Heart of the U.S.S. Enterprise
author: Tom W. Hartung
card_content_html:
Mr. Spock's image shows he is very cool, logical, and decisive. It stands in stark contrast to the warm image of the emotional Dr. McCoy.

These spiritual portraits show how McCoy's and Spock's differing temperaments cause them to frequently find themselves in conflict with one another.
card_first_person_html:
The profiles and images of the three main characters in Star Trek were among the first I did back in the 1980s, so it makes sense they should be the first posted on this site.

In addition to showing the contrast between Spock's coolness and McCoy's warmth, the Doctor's image shows he is both more outgoing and open-minded than Spock. These qualities help make him seem all that more human than the aloof and stubborn Spock.
